newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.

text.p: * The government will draft a package of laws within the next two months to encourage foreign investors to come to Romania, Prime Minister Victor Ciorbea told a seminar organised by the Economist Group.
He said direct foreign investment was Romania's only chance of economic revival.
The seminar brings together cabinet members and some 150 potential foreign investors.
* Foreign minister Adrian Severin's meeting with former King Michael scheduled for Tuesday morning did not take place on grounds of protocol, ministry spokeswoman Gilda Lazar said.
The meeting will be rescheduled for Wednesday, she said.
* Exiled King Michael is expected to meet President Emil Constantinescu on Tuesday, at 1900 hours, for a private dinner at Constantinescu's presidential palace.
* The lower Chamber of Deputies passed a bill to grant three-year soft loans for the creation of small- and medium-sized entreprises which hire unemployed people.
* Upper Senate's chairman Petre Roman, on an official visit to Spain, met Spain's King Juan Carlos, Prime Minister Jose Maria Aznar and Foreign Minister Abel Matutes.
Spain supports Romania's bid to be invited to join NATO when the Alliance announces its first eastward expansion later this year, Matutes told Roman.
* Roman invited King Juan Carlos to visit Romania.
